pullRequest.title: Add correlation id to Token Parameters and Authentication Result
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR achieve?
In this PR, (at a high level) we've done the following:

Accept (optional) correlation id from devs on TokenParameters
Expose correlation id on AuthenticationResult
Add tests for the above two points

Why is this being done?
This work was requested from CSS team and also customers have a desire to use their own correlation id. See this work item: https://dev.azure.com/IdentityDivision/Engineering/_workitems/edit/875728
Other libraries have also already implemented this.
Here's an example of it in DotNet

Correlation id on token params: See this link
Correlation id on Authentication Result: See this link

Here's an example of it in iOS

Correlation id on token params: See this link
Correlation id on Authentication Result: See this link

How are we doing it?
We are following the same design as shown above in DotNet example which is to accept a GUID or UUID for correlation id on TokenParameters - this will be optional and can be specified via the builder.
If the dev does not specify a correlation id then we generate our own as we do today.
When returning the result (Authentication Result) back to the caller, we set the correlation id on this result - this is whatever correlation id was used for that request (which would be either the one we generated or the one passed in by the dev).
This PR also depends on common PR: AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-library-common-for-android#925

commit.message: Add correlation id to Authentication Result
Add new line at end of IAuthenticationResult.java

nodes.bodyText: Is it possible that these could be final?
Should we have one of these that just takes a UUID where we don't need to convert it?
Any need to eagerly convert it to a string here?  We could wait...
Should we test the behavior here with strings that are not valid UUIDs?

commit.message: Add unit tests for command parameters and correlation id
Add unit tests for Authentication Result and correlation id
